zone.line: But in the open light of truth. Maddalo
He ceased, and overcome leant back awhile
Then cloud rising with a melancholy smiled
Went to a sofa, & sat lay down & slept
A quie heavy sleep , & in his dreams

line.del: That man I the must be a more complete

zone.line: And in his sleep we could observe, he wept,
And muttered some familiar name: and we
Wept without shame in his society
I truth I think I never was impressed so much
Madd The man, who were not must have lacked the
then a touch
Of human nature: more we lingered not
— Although our argument was quite forgot
We called the sufferers nurse:
But calling his attendants, went to dine
At Maddalo's, But neither cheer nor wine
Could give us spirits; each was pondering still
and we talked of him

line.del: All he they called the maniac said

zone.line: And nothing else, even till the stars grew dim
And we agreed that it was secret love
it was some dreadful ill
Wrought
Inflicted on him boldly, yet unspeakable
